newsitem.title: MOROCCO: Morocco buys 48,000T optional-origin vegoil - official.
newsitem.headline: Morocco buys 48,000T optional-origin vegoil - official.

text.p: Morocco bought 48,000 tonnes of optional-origin vegetable oil at $544.5 per tonne C&F for delivery between February and April, an official at the Bureau d'Approvisionnement en Huiles Alimentaires (BUR-APPRO) said on Thursday.
U.S. export sources said on Wednesday Morocco had initially tendered for 66,000 tonnes.
One lot of 12,000 tonnes was for delivery February 16-28, the official said.
Another lot of 18,000 tonnes was for March 1-15 delivery and the third lot of 18,000 tonnes was for April 16-30 arrival.
BUR-APPRO said the two first lots were bought from trader Nidera and the third from Cargill.
These quantities, a mixture of soyoil and colza (rape) oil, will be delivered at Casablanca port, it added, but gave no other details.
